messages.subject: Re: OT: Kingdom Hearts
messages.msgSnippet: Kristie, We just bought this game for my hubby for father s day, and he loves it.  We have the booklet, so anything you want to know, just ask. He did tell me,
messages.messageBody:
Kristie,

We just bought this game for my hubby for father's day, and he loves
it. We have the booklet, so anything you want to know, just ask.
He did tell me, most of the time, you just get what the character
says in words. He had mentioned something about photocopying the
booklet for you, and scanning it to your email. We don't have a
scanner here at home, but maybe he does at work. Let me know what
you need.









--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Kristie Cochran
<kristiecochran@...> wrote:
>
> Jared (5yo) just picked out Kingdom Hearts from the Video store
today.
> We got a used copy, and there was no book in there. I'm trying to
> figure out who's who and what we're supposed to do. Also, is
there any
> way to turn on the dialog in this game? He can't read yet, so
he's
> constantly getting me to "come read this!". I did find a very
lengthy
> (166pg) walkthru, but I'm looking for something more concise.
>
> Any helpful tips and tricks would be most appreciated! Feel free
to
> email me privately.
>
> Thanks!
> Kristie in VA
>

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] OT: Kingdom Hearts
messages.msgSnippet: ... My daughter used Game FAQs a lot: http://www.gamefaqs.com/ In addition to walkthroughs, they often have other types of FAQs for each game, like lists of
messages.messageBody:
On Aug 21, 2006, at 6:22 PM, Kristie Cochran wrote:

> I did find a very lengthy
> (166pg) walkthru, but I'm looking for something more concise.

My daughter used Game FAQs a lot:

http://www.gamefaqs.com/

In addition to walkthroughs, they often have other types of FAQs for
each game, like lists of enemies and so forth.

And if you type in "kingdom hearts strategy guide" at Amazon there
are bound to be some used guides for a few dollars. They have maps
and charts and lists galore. As a bonus to being useful for the game,
a great *real* exposure to math being put to real uses.

Joyce

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: OT: Kingdom Hearts
messages.msgSnippet: Jared (5yo) just picked out Kingdom Hearts from the Video store today. We got a used copy, and there was no book in there.  I m trying to figure out who s who
messages.messageBody:
Jared (5yo) just picked out Kingdom Hearts from the Video store today.
We got a used copy, and there was no book in there. I'm trying to
figure out who's who and what we're supposed to do. Also, is there any
way to turn on the dialog in this game? He can't read yet, so he's
constantly getting me to "come read this!". I did find a very lengthy
(166pg) walkthru, but I'm looking for something more concise.

Any helpful tips and tricks would be most appreciated! Feel free to
email me privately.

Thanks!
Kristie in VA
